required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Semagacestat for Alzheimer's Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label Extension for Alzheimer's Disease Patients Who Complete One of Two Semagacestat Phase 3 Double-Blind Studies (H6L-MC-LFAN or H6L-MC-LFBC)

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of the original study was to assess the safety of semagacestat in Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients during 24 months of open-label treatment. Baseline for the efficacy measures is defined as the baseline for feeder studies LFAN (NCT00594568) and LFBC (NCT00762411). For all safety analyses (adverse events), baseline for patients will be week 0 of this study (LFBF).
Preliminary results from LFAN and LFBC showed semagacestat did not slow disease progression and was associated with worsening of clinical measures of cognition and the ability to perform activities of daily living. Study drug was stopped in all studies. Studies LFAN, LFBC and LFBF have been amended to continue collecting safety data, including cognitive scores, for at least seven months. The CT-Registry will reflect results of analyses from the original protocol in addition to those from the amended protocol. Very few participants from LFBC rolled over into LFBF (N = 9). Due to insufficient sample size, the data for LFBC participants who rolled into LFBF were not analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog11) at Week 16 After Cessation of Study Drug
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (LFAN randomization), 16 weeks (LFBF) after cessation of study drug
primary_outcome.description: The cognitive subscale of the ADAS (ADAS-Cog11) consists of 11 items assessing areas of function most typically impaired in Alzheimer's Disease (AD): orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis. The scale ranges from 0 to 70, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study Activities of Daily Living Inventory (ADCS-ADL) at Week 16 After Cessation of Study Drug
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (LFAN randomization), 16 weeks (LFBF) after cessation of study drug
primary_outcome.description: The ADCS-ADL is a 23-item inventory developed as a rater-administered questionnaire answered by the participant's caregiver. It measures both basic and instrumental activities of daily living. The total score ranges from 0 to 78, with lower scores indicating greater disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Amyloid Beta (Aβ) 1-42 Plasma Concentration at Week 12
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (LFAN Randomization ), 6 hours pose-dose at Week 12 (LFBF)
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of amino acid peptide known as Aβ 1-42 in plasma. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hippocampal Volume Using Volumetric Magnetic Resonance Imaging (vMRI) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The vMRI assessment of right hippocampal and left hippocampal volume is reported. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Amyloid Imaging Positron Emission Tomography (AV-45-PET) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: A radioactive tracer for PET that is a ligand for amyloid called [18F]-AV-45. This permits the visualization of amyloid in the brains of Alzheimer's participants. The outcome reported is the composite summary of the standard uptake value ratio for the cerebellar gray matter. Least Squares (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator. Due to insufficient sample size, this analysis was not done.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog11) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The cognitive subscale of the ADAS (ADAS-Cog11) consists of 11 items assessing areas of function most typically impaired in Alzheimer's Disease (AD): orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis. The scale ranges from 0 to 70, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog12) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: ADAS-Cog12 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with the delayed free recall measure, resulting in a total score ranging from 0 to 80. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog14) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The ADAS-Cog14 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with delayed free recall, digit cancellation, and maze completion measures. A score of 0 to 10 for delayed free recall and a conversion code of 0 to 5 for digit cancellation and maze completion provide total score ranges for this extended ADAS-Cog14 of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for the baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study Activities of Daily Living Inventory (ADCS-ADL) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The ADCS-ADL is a 23-item inventory developed as a rater-administered questionnaire answered by the participant's caregiver. It measures both basic and instrumental activities of daily living. The total score ranges from 0 to 78, with lower scores indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog12) at Week 16 After Cessation of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (LFAN Randomization), 16 weeks (LFBF) after cessation of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: ADAS-Cog12 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with the delayed free recall measure, resulting in a total score ranging from 0 to 80. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog14) at Week 16 After Cessation of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (LFAN Randomization), 16 weeks (LFBF) after cessation of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: The ADAS-Cog14 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with delayed free recall, digit cancellation, and maze completion measures. A score of 0 to 10 for delayed free recall and a conversion code of 0 to 5 for digit cancellation and maze completion provide total score ranges for this extended ADAS-Cog14 of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinical Dementia Rating Scale (Sum of Boxes) (CDR-SB) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The CDR-SB is a semi-structured interview of participants and their caregivers. The participant's cognitive status is rated in 6 domains of functioning, including memory, orientation, judgment and problem solving, community affairs, home and hobbies, and personal care. A severity score is assigned for each of the 6 domains with total score ranging from 0 to 18. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The MMSE is a brief screening instrument used to assess cognitive function in elderly participants. It assesses orientation, memory, attention, and ability to name objects, follow verbal and written commands, write a sentence, and copy figures. The total score ranges from 0 to 30, with a lower score indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The NPI is a tool for assessing psychopathology in patients with dementia and other neurologic disorders. Information is obtained from a caregiver familiar with the patient's behavior. The score ranges from 12 to 144, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for the baseline value, age, investigator, concomitant standard of care medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D (proxy version) measures mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression; each has 3 severity levels (no, some, severe problems) coded to a 1-digit number (1-3). Digits are combined into 5-digit number describing health state. Numbers 1-3 are not added for total score. Visual Analog Scale (VAS) assesses caregiver's impression of participant's overall health state; VAS scores range=0-100, with lower scores indicating greater disease severity. LS Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Resource Utilization in Dementia-Lite Questionnaire (RUD-Lite) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: RUD-Lite assesses the healthcare resource utilization of participants and their caregivers to determine the level of formal and informal care attributable to Alzheimer's Disease (AD). Information on both caregivers (caregiving time, work status) and participants (accommodation and healthcare resource utilization) is collected from the baseline and follow-up interviews. Reported the change in number of hospitalizations per participant to week 12.

intervention.description: 140mg administered orally, once daily for 24 months; dose reduction to 100mg or 60 mg possible due to intolerability

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meets National Institute of Neurological and Communicative Disorders and Stroke/Alzheimer's Disease and Related Disorders Association (NINCDS/ADRDA) criteria for probable Alzheimer's Disease
- Completed semagacestat study LFAN or study LFBC through 88 weeks
- Must continue to have a reliable caregiver
- Capable of swallowing whole oral medication
- Agrees not to participate in other investigational compounds for the duration of study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Meets LFAN or LFBC study discontinuation criteria at the last visit of the LFAN or LFBC study

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 milligram (mg) orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN LY 100 mg/ LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 (LY 100 mg) orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN LY 100 mg/ LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog11)
measure.description: The cognitive subscale of the ADAS (ADAS-Cog11) was used as a primary efficacy measure and consisted of 11 items assessing areas of function most typically impaired in AD: orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis. The scale ranged from 0-70, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity.

measure.title: Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study Activities of Daily Living Inventory (ADCS-ADL)
measure.description: The ADCS-ADL was a 23-item inventory developed as a rater-administered questionnaire answered by the participant's caregiver. It measures both basic and instrumental activities of daily living. The total ADCS-ADL score ranged from 0-78, with lower scores indicating greater disease severity.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog11) at Week 16 After Cessation of Study Drug
outcome.description: The cognitive subscale of the ADAS (ADAS-Cog11) consists of 11 items assessing areas of function most typically impaired in Alzheimer's Disease (AD): orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis. The scale ranges from 0 to 70, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (LFAN randomization), 16 weeks (LFBF) after cessation of study drug
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN LY 100 mg/ LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog11) at Week 16 After Cessation of Study Drug
measure.description: The cognitive subscale of the ADAS (ADAS-Cog11) consists of 11 items assessing areas of function most typically impaired in Alzheimer's Disease (AD): orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis. The scale ranges from 0 to 70, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

It measures both basic and instrumental activities of daily living. The total score ranges from 0 to 78, with lower scores indicating greater disease severity.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Amyloid Beta (Aβ) 1-42 Plasma Concentration at Week 12
outcome.description: Concentration of amino acid peptide known as Aβ 1-42 in plasma. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (LFAN Randomization ), 6 hours pose-dose at Week 12 (LFBF)
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hippocampal Volume Using Volumetric Magnetic Resonance Imaging (vMRI) at Week 12
outcome.description: The vMRI assessment of right hippocampal and left hippocampal volume is reported. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hippocampal Volume Using Volumetric Magnetic Resonance Imaging (vMRI) at Week 12
measure.description: The vMRI assessment of right hippocampal and left hippocampal volume is reported. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Amyloid Imaging Positron Emission Tomography (AV-45-PET) at Week 12
outcome.description: A radioactive tracer for PET that is a ligand for amyloid called [18F]-AV-45. This permits the visualization of amyloid in the brains of Alzheimer's participants. The outcome reported is the composite summary of the standard uptake value ratio for the cerebellar gray matter. Least Squares (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator. Due to insufficient sample size, this analysis was not done.
outcome.population: Due to insufficient sample size, this analysis was not done.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.description: A radioactive tracer for PET that is a ligand for amyloid called [18F]-AV-45. This permits the visualization of amyloid in the brains of Alzheimer's participants. The outcome reported is the composite summary of the standard uptake value ratio for the cerebellar gray matter. Least Squares (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, and investigator. Due to insufficient sample size, this analysis was not done.

outcome.description: The cognitive subscale of the ADAS (ADAS-Cog11) consists of 11 items assessing areas of function most typically impaired in Alzheimer's Disease (AD): orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis. The scale ranges from 0 to 70, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog11) at Week 12
measure.description: The cognitive subscale of the ADAS (ADAS-Cog11) consists of 11 items assessing areas of function most typically impaired in Alzheimer's Disease (AD): orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis. The scale ranges from 0 to 70, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog12) at Week 12
outcome.description: ADAS-Cog12 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with the delayed free recall measure, resulting in a total score ranging from 0 to 80. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during Study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog12) at Week 12
measure.description: ADAS-Cog12 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with the delayed free recall measure, resulting in a total score ranging from 0 to 80. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog14) at Week 12
outcome.description: The ADAS-Cog14 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with delayed free recall, digit cancellation, and maze completion measures. A score of 0 to 10 for delayed free recall and a conversion code of 0 to 5 for digit cancellation and maze completion provide total score ranges for this extended ADAS-Cog14 of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for the baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale - Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog14) at Week 16 After Cessation of Study Drug
measure.description: The ADAS-Cog14 is the ADAS-Cog11 augmented with delayed free recall, digit cancellation, and maze completion measures. measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Dementia Rating Scale (Sum of Boxes) (CDR-SB) at Week 24
outcome.description: The CDR-SB is a semi-structured interview of participants and their caregivers. The participant's cognitive status is rated in 6 domains of functioning, including memory, orientation, judgment and problem solving, community affairs, home and hobbies, and personal care. A severity score is assigned for each of the 6 domains with total score ranging from 0 to 18. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Dementia Rating Scale (Sum of Boxes) (CDR-SB) at Week 24
measure.description: The CDR-SB is a semi-structured interview of participants and their caregivers. The participant's cognitive status is rated in 6 domains of functioning, including memory, orientation, judgment and problem solving, community affairs, home and hobbies, and personal care. A severity score is assigned for each of the 6 domains with total score ranging from 0 to 18. Higher scores indicate greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) at Week 24
outcome.description: The MMSE is a brief screening instrument used to assess cognitive function in elderly participants. It assesses orientation, memory, attention, and ability to name objects, follow verbal and written commands, write a sentence, and copy figures. The total score ranges from 0 to 30, with a lower score indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN LY 100 mg/ LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) at Week 24
measure.description: The MMSE is a brief screening instrument used to assess cognitive function in elderly participants. It assesses orientation, memory, attention, and ability to name objects, follow verbal and written commands, write a sentence, and copy figures. The total score ranges from 0 to 30, with a lower score indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) at Week 24
outcome.description: The NPI is a tool for assessing psychopathology in patients with dementia and other neurologic disorders. Information is obtained from a caregiver familiar with the patient’s behavior. The score ranges from 12 to 144, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for the baseline value, age, investigator, concomitant standard of care medication.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN LY 100 mg/ LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) at Week 24
measure.description: The NPI is a tool for assessing psychopathology in patients with dementia and other neurologic disorders. Information is obtained from a caregiver familiar with the patient’s behavior. The score ranges from 12 to 144, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Least Square (LS) Mean value was controlled for the baseline value, age, investigator, concomitant standard of care medication.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) at Week 24
outcome.description: EQ-5D (proxy version) measures mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression; each has 3 severity levels (no, some, severe problems) coded to a 1-digit number (1-3). Digits are combined into 5-digit number describing health state. Numbers 1-3 are not added for total score. Visual Analog Scale (VAS) assesses caregiver's impression of participant's overall health state; VAS scores range=0-100, with lower scores indicating greater disease severity. LS Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) at Week 24
measure.description: EQ-5D (proxy version) measures mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression; each has 3 severity levels (no, some, severe problems) coded to a 1-digit number (1-3). Digits are combined into 5-digit number describing health state. Numbers 1-3 are not added for total score. Visual Analog Scale (VAS) assesses caregiver's impression of participant's overall health state; VAS scores range=0-100, with lower scores indicating greater disease severity. LS Mean value was controlled for baseline value, age, investigator, and concomitant standard of care (SOC) medication.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Resource Utilization in Dementia-Lite Questionnaire (RUD-Lite) at Week 12
outcome.description: RUD-Lite assesses the healthcare resource utilization of participants and their caregivers to determine the level of formal and informal care attributable to Alzheimer's Disease (AD). Information on both caregivers (caregiving time, work status) and participants (accommodation and healthcare resource utilization) is collected from the baseline and follow-up interviews. Reported the change in number of hospitalizations per participant to week 12.
outcome.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Resource Utilization in Dementia-Lite Questionnaire (RUD-Lite) at Week 12
measure.description: RUD-Lite assesses the healthcare resource utilization of participants and their caregivers to determine the level of formal and informal care attributable to Alzheimer's Disease (AD). Information on both caregivers (caregiving time, work status) and participants (accommodation and healthcare resource utilization) is collected from the baseline and follow-up interviews. Reported the change in number of hospitalizations per participant to week 12.
measure.population: Participants who completed Study LFAN, took at least one dose of study drug in extension study and had both baseline and post-baseline values.

group.title: LFAN Placebo/LY140 mg
group.description: Participants received placebo orally once daily for 76 weeks during study LFAN. At the end of 76 weeks, participants received LY450319 titrated up to 140 mg orally once daily. Participants continued 140 mg LY450319 (LY 140 mg) orally once daily up to 24 months during this extension study (LFBF)

group.title: LFAN LY 100 mg/ LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 100 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

group.title: LFAN LY 140 mg/LY 140 mg
group.description: Participants received 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily during study LFAN, and 140 mg LY450319 orally once daily up to 24 months during extension study

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Very few participants from LFBC rolled over into LFBF (N = 9). Due to insufficient sample size, the data for LFBC participants who rolled into LFBF were not analyzed.
